scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.10 is not included in the catalogue of recommended standards of Member States that have a National Interoperability Framework fully aligned with the EIF. 

See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to the publication of data as Open Data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicale to this specification.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
Connecting Europe Facility (CEF) is meant to focus its activity on the improvement of European Cooperation processes and solutions, for both, private and public sectors. The development of the specifications included in the eDelivery building block performance are raised up by CEF eDelivery Team, which does not need to open their decisions by means of public consultations. However, CEF provides several communities focused on gather information related to best practices regarding the implementation of eDelivery. Moreover, the community eDelivery Governance aims to focus efforts to open the operational matters related to CEF building Blocks to all stakeholders for contribution. This fact helps to ensure that all parts take part in the development process, private sector, user organisations and standardisations 
See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: A public review is part of the decision-making process.
statement:
Despite the openness provided by eDelivery Governance Space, which purpose is to enable different parties to get involved in the development of the Building Blocks and all their components, a public review is not part of the decision-making-process.

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP+-+1.10

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for everyone to study.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.10 is available for everyone to study and implement for free. The specification can be found at Connecting Europe Facility’s (CEF) webpage. 

See:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP+-+1.10

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
eDelivery SMP has diverse implications in terms of Intellectual Property Rights. On one hand, the SMP 1.0 specification which is under non-assertion IPR policy, from OASIS IPR Policy. On the other hand, the ministry of Justice and the European Commission are in charge of part of the specification content. The specification is  licensed under (F) RAND basis and Royalty-free basis. 

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP+-+1.10#eDeliverySMP-1.10-Ownership
https://www.oasis-open.org/policies-guidelines/ipr

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is licensed on a royalty-free basis
statement:
eDelivery SMP has diverse implications in terms of Intellectual Property Rights. On one hand, the SMP 1.0 specification which is under non-assertion IPR policy, from OASIS IPR Policy. On the other hand, the ministry of Justice and the European Commission are in charge of part of the specification content. Therefore, the specification is licensed under (F) RAND basis and Royalty-free basis. 

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP+-+1.10#eDeliverySMP-1.10-Ownership

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is sufficiently mature and has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.10 is an evolution of the previous e-SENS SMP, which evolves from the PEPPOL SMP specification and was standardised by OASIS. The assessed specification continues strictly related to SMP 1.0 as is an extended profile for eDelivery Building Block. Therefore, these facts demonstrate that eDelivery SMP 1.10 is mature enough to be used in the creation of products and solutions. Additionally, it is supported by Open sources and commercial, which ensures its market acceptance. 
See:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Background

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement:
The specification is involved in the creation of interoperable solutions for data exchange across borders, which aims to evolve public administrations to reduce administrative burdens meanwhile adapt to new ICT needs. CEF’s Building Blocks can be considered as innovative solutions in the field of eAdministrations and eGovernment, therefore, eDelivery SMP 1.10 fosters the creation of innovative solutions. 
See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Background

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.10 has the support of CEF eDelivery team which is in charge of the maintenance of the profile. Moreover, the SMP 1.0 is developed by OASIS, one of most relevant international standardisation organisations
See:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP+-+1.10

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the visibility and comprehensibility of administrative rules, processes, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
statement:
The specification is a key enabler for the metadata exchange. It is part of the eDelivery Building Block defined by CEF, which aims to foster data exchange and reuse across borders enhancing the interoperability in Europe. Moreover, eDelivery SMP 1.10 helps in the decision-making process by allowing data exchange between administrations.
See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Benefits+of+eDelivery

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification helps ensuring the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
statement: eDelivery provide guidelines for the implementations of OASIS SMP 1.0, which has the goal to define the protocol and binding to a REST interface. Therefore, a conformant implementation of the eDelivery fosters the availability of interfaces with internal information systems.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.
statement: eDelivery SMP 1.10 is an open specification based on the OASIS’s standard SMP 1.0. As SMP is an agnostic standard, eDelivery SMP 1.10 inherits this property. Thus, it can be reused in any business domain requiring metadata management and exchange.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.0 is available for free at CEF’s website, which is an open resource for the European development. 
See:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP+-+1.10

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is independent from any specific technology and/or platform.
statement:
The specification defines an XML-based service metadata data model and a REST binding to retrieve service metadata. Even being XML-based, as XML is a widely adopted and supported specification, it does not hamper the interoperability of systems. Additionally,  is independent of any other specific vendor product and it is supported by open and commercial solutions
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Background

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The implementation of the specification does not hamper the scalability and interoperability of systems. As part of the stack of the eDelivery Building Block, eDelivery SMP 1.10 allows enabling users to grow according to administrations or businesses' needs. 
See:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Benefits+of+eDelivery

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement: The implementation of the specification fosters interoperability between administrations across borders. Moreover, it is a European interoperability solution component included in the eDelivery building block. The purpose of the building block is to enhance the eGovernment in the context of the interoperability and the reuse of administrations’ data.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.
statement: eDelivery SMP 1.10 fosters the implementation of the Once-Only Principle by allowing public administrations to share and reuse their information across borders.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters e-accessibility.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to e-accessibility. Therefore, e-Delivery SMP 1.10 is not easing the e-accessibility.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement: The specification is included in eDelivery Service provided by CEF, which has the aim of providing a secure infrastructure and services for data exchanging. Additionally, eDelivery SMP 1.10 is based on the OASIS’s SMP 1.0 standard, which provides security features involving X509 encryption. Therefore, eDelivery SMP 1.10 eases the secure and trustworthy data exchange between different parties involved.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to fostering multilingualism. Therefore, e-Delivery SMP 1.10 is not related to multilingualism.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The adoption of the standard or specification reduces the administrative burden.
statement: e-Delivery SMP 1.10 is part of eDelivery stack, which allows document and data exchange between different parts within a public or private network. The implementation of the specification along with the eDelivery Building Block stack, is a key enabler for data exchange, which allows administrations to reduce administrative burdens. Some of the administrative burdens are the non-digital data exchange or the time that implies these exchanges among others.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to the long-term preservation of electronic records. Therefore, e-Delivery SMP 1.10 is not fostering the long-term preservation of electronic resources.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the standard or specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
statement: No evidences have been found of existing assessments regarding effectiveness or efficiency of the specification that allow to answer positively to this criterion.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification can be mapped to the EIRA.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.10 is already associated with EIRA ABBs in the European Library Of Specifications (ELIS). Specifically, eDelivery SMP 1.10 can define the interoperability aspects of “Metadata Management Component”, “Metadata Management Service”, and “Interoperable European Solution Component” ABBs of the EIRA Technical View.
See: 
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/elis/distribution/eliscataloguev100betaxlsx

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the standard or specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
statement:
CEF’s Action has developed a tool for testing the conformance of eDelivery Access Point and SMP specifications. This tool include eDelivery SMP 1.10 as it can be read in the CEF eDelivery Conformance Testing Document Service.
See:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/download/attachments/82773210/%28CEFeDelivery%29%20%28ConformanceTesting%29%20%28SOD%29%20%28v2%2010%29.pdf?version=1&modificationDate=1538392192100&api=v2

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is recommended by a EU Member State.
statement: The specification is not recommended by any Member State within their national catalogues for ICT. Despite this, eDelivery SMP 1.10 is a European profile recommended by the European public bodies in order to establish a common interoperability framework.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification has been selected for its use in a EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.10 is part of the eDelivery Building Block (BB), which is provided by CEF and aims to help public administrations to share electronic data across borders in a reliable way. The BB eases the integration between implementers fostering the creation of interoperable infrastructures used for the digital data exchange. 

See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/How+does+eDelivery+work

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
statement: The specification is not included in any Member State national catalogue for ICT. Despite this, eDelivery SMP 1.10 is a European profile recommended by the European public bodies in order to establish a common interoperability framework.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.10 is not included in any official supra-national catalogue. However, it is included in the full stack catalogue of eDelivery at CEF’s webpage. 
See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/Services+eDelivery

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement:
After carrying out an exhaustive research on this topic, no evidence has been found regarding the existence of a formal agreement between European public services providers involving the implementation of eDelivery SMP 1.10. However, the specification appears included within the eDelivery stack in the EU eGovernment Action Plan 2016-2020. The European communication coming from European Parliament, the Council, the European Economic and Social Committee and the Committee of the Regions aims to propose recommendations and actions to be done in order to enhance the interoperability across borders. 
See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/isa2/sites/isa/files/docs/publications/eu-egovernment-action-plan-2016-2020_en.pdf

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement: There is no assessment regarding the compliance of the specification with European Standardisation Regulation 1025/2012. Despite CEF is a European Commission action, there is no evidence to answer positively to this criterion.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling standard or specification.
statement: The purpose of the specifications is to define technical interoperability aspects. Therefore, eDelivery is used for business modelling processes.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement: The purpose of the specifications is to define technical interoperability aspects. Therefore, the eDelivery SMP 1.10 does not define organisational interoperability aspects.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
eDelivery SMP 1.10 does not define a cross-sector reusable data model per se, this profile defines a set of implementation guidelines for the OASIS SMP Specification applied to eDelivery. However, OASIS standard defines a data model for the retrieving interface. 
See: 
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP+-+1.10
http://docs.oasis-open.org/bdxr/bdx-smp/v1.0/bdx-smp-v1.0.html

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The standard or specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement: The purpose of the specification is not related to the publication of data as Linked Open Data. Therefore, e-Delivery SMP 1.10 is not fostering the publication of Linked Open Data.

criterion_description: The standard or specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
statement:
The specification is maintained and developed by the CEF eDelivery Team and all the information related to the specification and its implementation can be found at CEF’s webpage.
See:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+SMP+-+1.10
